text.p: The Commonwealth Bank of Australia (CBA) said on Tuesday that the start to the 1996/97 financial year beginning July 1 was proving to be as challenging as expected.
Commonwealth Bank chairman Tim Besley said in his address the bank's annual meeting that the bank had previously described the outlook for the bank's in 1996/97 earnings as flat.
"We are now three months into the financial year and nothing has changed to prompt the bank to revise this assessment," Besley said.
"1996/97 is shaping up to be every bit as challenging as we envisaged," he said.

Commonwealth Bank reported a net profit of A$1.12 billion in 1995/96, up from A$983 million in 1994/95, and said when it released its results in August that it expected earnings to be flat in 1996/97.
